message: [branching off the hg-git topic...] there's been interest in ways to deal with sub-repos. The discussion looks dated here http://mercurial.selenic.com/wiki/NestedRepositories -- so what works with what caveats?
(off topic) seems that there is nothing indicating where this was branched from (except for those who was on that topic), smells like another missing feature ;-)

As seen at the top of that page old strategies for nested repositories (forest extensions and "don't") have been replaced with http://mercurial.selenic.com/wiki/Subrepository which is seeing active development and quite polished already.
As of version 1.8, Mercurial supports git subrepositories -- how's that working out in practice?
As I understand it they're best considered read-only.  They rely on hg-git and currently durin42, most recent author, is busy at Google.
git subrepos do not use hg-git, they you just command line version of git and it works for basic scenarios (haven't tried anything fancy)
ah, good to know.  I also see that with today's 1.8 release folks pitched in to bring hg-big back to healthy.
